# interval

**Instance Property**

An integer providing a suggested interval between scheduling and invoking the activity.

## Declaration

```swift
var interval: TimeInterval { get set }
```

## Discussion

For repeating activities, the value of this property is also the suggested interval between invocations. See [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSBackgroundActivityScheduler#Configure-Scheduler-Properties].

## Background Scheduler Attributes

- **identifier**: A unique reverse DNS notation string, such as `com.example.MyApp.updatecheck`, that identifies the activity.
- **repeats**: A Boolean value indicating whether the activity should be rescheduled after it completes.
- **qualityOfService**: A value of type `NSQualityOfService`, which controls how aggressively the system schedules the activity.
- **shouldDefer**: A Boolean value indicating whether your app should stop performing background activity and resume at a more optimal time.
- **tolerance**: A value of type [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/TimeInterval], which specifies a range of time during which the background activity may occur.
